required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-Center, Randomized, Double-Blind, Phosphate Buffered Saline-Controlled Study to Evaluate Effectiveness and Safety of a Single Intra-Articular Injection of Gel-OneÂ® for the Treatment of Osteoarthritis of the Knee With Open-Label Safety Extension

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether Gel-One demonstrates a superior effectiveness in osteoarthritis (OA) knee pain compared with phosphate buffered saline (PBS) injections.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Visual Analogue Scores (VAS) Following 50-foot Walk Test Through Week 26
primary_outcome.description: Observed VAS of 100 mm; 0 mm meaning no pain; 100 mm meaning extreme pain following 50-foot walk test. Change in score from baseline through week 26 was estimated using a longitudinal model.

arm_group.description: 3 mL, a single intra-articular injection of Gel-One
3 mL, a single intra-articular injection of PBS

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Have a knee pain
- Grade 1 to 3 on the Kellgren-Lawrence grading scale
Exclusion Criteria:
- BMI greater than 35 kg/m2
- Received an intra-articular hyaluronic acid injection for the treatment of OA of the knee within 6 months prior to screening
- Had a joint replacement of the target knee

group.title: Gel-One
group.description: The participants received a single intra-articular injection of Gel-One.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: The participants received a single intra-articular injection of Phosphate Buffered Saline (PBS).

group.title: Gel-One
group.description: The participants received a single intra-articular injection of Gel-One.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: The participants received a single intra-articular injection of PBS.

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measure.title: Kellgren-Lawrence score
measure.description: The Kellgren-Lawrence score is radiological classification of knee osteoarthritis. It progresses from grade 0 to grade IV and classified based on x-rays.

measure.title: 50-foot walk test VAS pain score
measure.description: Observed Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) pain score of 100 mm; 0 mm meaning no pain; 100 mm meaning extreme target knee pain following 50-foot walk test.

measure.title: 50-foot walk test contralateral VAS pain score
measure.description: Observed VAS pain score of 100 mm; 0 mm meaning no pain; 100 mm meaning extreme contralateral knee pain following 50-foot walk test.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Visual Analogue Scores (VAS) Following 50-foot Walk Test Through Week 26
outcome.description: Observed VAS of 100 mm; 0 mm meaning no pain; 100 mm meaning extreme pain following 50-foot walk test. Change in score from baseline through week 26 was estimated using a longitudinal model.

group.title: Gel-One
group.description: The participants received a single intra-articular injection of Gel-One.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: The participants received a single intra-articular injection of PBS.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Visual Analogue Scores (VAS) Following 50-foot Walk Test Through Week 26
measure.description: Observed VAS of 100 mm; 0 mm meaning no pain; 100 mm meaning extreme pain following 50-foot walk test. Change in score from baseline through week 26 was estimated using a longitudinal model.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Visual Analogue Scores (VAS) Following 50-foot Walk Test at Week 26
outcome.description: Observed VAS of 100 mm; 0 mm meaning no pain; 100 mm meaning extreme pain following 50-foot walk test. Change in score from baseline to week 26 was calculated as baseline minus week 26.
outcome.population: The post-hoc analysis plan pre-specified that only the change at week 26 in the Gel-One arm is intended to be analyzed.

group.title: Gel-One
group.description: The participants received a single intra-articular injection of Gel-One.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Visual Analogue Scores (VAS) Following 50-foot Walk Test at Week 26
measure.description: Observed VAS of 100 mm; 0 mm meaning no pain; 100 mm meaning extreme pain following 50-foot walk test. Change in score from baseline to week 26 was calculated as baseline minus week 26.
measure.population: The post-hoc analysis plan pre-specified that only the change at week 26 in the Gel-One arm is intended to be analyzed.

analysis.groups_desc: A post-hoc non-inferiority comparison of the Gel-One mean change from baseline in VAS pain score at week 26 (Following 50-foot walk test) against the same assessment collected from subjects treated with Euflexxa in a separate study (PMID:19539353) was also performed.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Euflexxa would be considered superior to Gel-One if the difference in mean change from baseline in VAS pain score at week 26 was 5 mm or greater (on the 100mm VAS pain scale). If the difference in mean change values were within 5 mm, Gel-One would not be considered inferior to Euflexxa.
analysis.other_analysis_desc: Change from baseline (95% CI) for Euflexxa was -25.7 (-29.0, -22.4) and the difference between Euflexxa and Gel-One (95% CI) was -3.8 (-inf, -0.3).

group.title: Gel-One
group.description: 3 mL, a single intra-articular injection of Gel-One.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: 3 mL, a single intra-articular injection of PBS.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
